title: WeedsGalore: A Multispectral and Multitemporal UAV-based Dataset for Crop and Weed Segmentation in Agricultural Maize Fields
author: Ekin Celikkan (GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences), Timo Kunzmann (GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences), Yertay Yeskaliyev (GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences), Sibylle Itzerott (GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences), Nadja Klein (Scientific Computing Center, Karlsruhe Institute of Technology), Martin Herold (GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences), ..., Martin Herold (GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences)
background: The study presents a dataset for accurately identifying weeds and crops in maize fields using a drone, which incorporates multispectral imaging to enhance segmentation.
contribution: WeedsGalore introduces a unique UAV-based dataset with detailed annotations for crops and multiple weed species to solve the challenge of fine-grained weed identification in maize, achieving improved model calibration and uncertainty quantification.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous datasets mainly utilized RGB imaging and lacked robust multispectral data or fine-grained annotations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work significantly enhances segmentation tasks by providing additional sensory bands (red-edge and near-infrared) and a larger variety of weeds across different growth stages.

key_innovation: The incorporation of multispectral imaging combined with precise pixel-level annotations provides a rich resource for training models tailored for real-world agricultural applications.
real_world_impact: Improves precision agriculture practices by facilitating enhanced automatic weed management using UAV technology, which can lead to increased crop yields and reduced herbicide usage.
limitations: The dataset may be limited to specific geographical and environmental conditions, which may not generalize universally across different agricultural settings.

new_terms.multispectral imaging: **Multispectral imaging** refers to the process of capturing image data at different wavelengths across the electromagnetic spectrum, including visible light and beyond, allowing for more detailed analysis of scenes.
new_terms.UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle): **Unmanned Aerial Vehicle** is an aircraft that operates without a human pilot on board, often used for various applications including aerial imaging in agriculture.

open_sourcing: The dataset and code are available at https://github.com/GFZ/weedsgalore.
